org.openntf.domino.email
Class DominoEmail

java.lang.Object
  org.openntf.domino.email.DominoEmail
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEmail
public class DominoEmail
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEmail

Author:
withersp Creates an email with text, HTML or JSON content. Also allows attachments. Based on Mark Leusink's XSnippet http://openntf.org/XSnippets.nsf/snippet.xsp?id=create-html-mails-in-ssjs-using-mime#sthash.U5Lgr7N8.dpuf Usage example (simple): DominoEmail myEmail = new DominoEmail(); myEmail.createSimpleEmail(toNames,ccNames,bccNames,"My Subject",body,"fromEmail@emailDomain.com"); Usage example (extended): var mail = new HTMLMail(); mail.setTo( "m.leusink@gmail.com") mail.setCC( ["user@domain.com", "anotheruser@domaino.com"] ); mail.setBB( "user3@domaino.com"); mail.setSubject("Your notification"); mail.addHTML("

Hi!

"); mail.addHTML("
contents in a table here
"); mail.addDocAttachment( "DC9126E84C59093FC1257953003C13E6", "jellyfish.jpg") mail.addFileAttachment( "c:/temp/report.pdf"); mail.setSender("m.leusink@gmail.com", "Mark Leusink"); mail.send();

createSimpleEmail

public Document createSimpleEmail(java.lang.Object toNames,
                                  java.lang.Object ccNames,
                                  java.lang.Object bccNames,
                                  java.lang.String subject,
                                  java.lang.Object body,
                                  java.lang.String sender)
Creates an email in two lines of code:
DominoEmail myEmail = new DominoEmail(); myEmail.createSimpleEmail(toNames,ccNames,bccNames,"My Subject",body,"fromEmail@emailDomain.com");

Parameters:
toNames - List, array or comma-separated string of names
ccNames - List, array or comma-separated string of names
bccNames - List, array or comma-separated string of names
subject - String subject
body - StringBuilder, String or MIMEEntity. StringBuilder is preferred to String
sender - String email address to send from
Returns:
Document successful memo
Since:
org.openntf.domino 4.5.0

convertObjectToList

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertObjectToList(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                                   java.lang.String separator)
Takes an object - String, List, Array - and converts it to a List for passing into to, cc, bcc

Parameters:
obj - object to be tested / converted into a List of strings
separator - String separator to use if obj is a multi-value string, e.g. comma-separated
Returns:
List of Strings
Since:
org.openntf.domino 4.5.0

generateContentId

private java.lang.String generateContentId()
Generates a content id. This is used to generate a unique reference for each attachment to be added to the email

Returns:
String result of @Unique
